summary: This bill, the Mississippi River Restoration and Resilience Initiative Act (MRRRI Act), aims to protect and restore the ecological health of the Mississippi River. It establishes a Mississippi River National Program Office within the EPA, outlines focus areas (water quality, community resilience, habitat restoration, invasive species prevention, and monitoring), and authorizes funding for projects carried out by federal agencies and non-federal entities, including grants. The bill requires action plans, scientific research, and annual reporting to Congress. It emphasizes coordination with various stakeholders, including tribal governments, and establishes research centers to support the initiative.
